meanings.definition: A person who is farsighted and has difficulty seeing objects up close.
meanings.sent1: The hyperope struggled to read the fine print on the menu.
meanings.sent2: The optometrist prescribed glasses to help the hyperope see better up close.
meanings.sent3: The hyperope joked that they needed a magnifying glass to read a text message.
meanings.sent4: Being a hyperope in a world of tiny smartphones felt like a constant battle.
meanings.sent5: The hyperope's vision was like looking through a blurry window when trying to read.

meanings.definition: A condition in which the eye is unable to focus on nearby objects.
meanings.sent1: The hyperope's eye doctor explained the challenges of this condition.
meanings.sent2: Wearing corrective lenses can greatly improve the vision of a hyperope.
meanings.sent3: The hyperope found it amusing that they could see far away but not up close.
meanings.sent4: The hyperope's eyes were like cameras constantly trying to adjust focus.
meanings.sent5: Living as a hyperope meant always needing to hold things at arm's length to see clearly.
